p: Mathematical models play a key role in decision making in pandemics. Projections of transmission, disease burden and infection control are essential elements of ‘outbreak science’ 9 10 and ‘pandemic preparedness’. 3 7 Variants of ‘susceptible-infected-recovered’ models are most common. 8 More complex stochastic and dynamic simulation models also play a role. Modelled pandemics include HIV, 11 hepatitis C, 12 severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), 10 13 H5N1 (avian influenza), 14 15 H1N1 (‘swine influenza’), 16 Ebola 17–21 and currently, COVID-19. 22 23
